name: Holiday Inn Express Toronto East

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel many times, about 3 times per year to visit family in the area. The hotel managers and staff provide a very friendly and courteous environment. We always enjoy our stay. The location is convenient, the rooms are very spacious and comfortable with free internet service. Price is also very good with breakfast included. We recommend to travelers seeking a good value in the greater Toronto area.
reviews.title: Very friendly place, good value

reviews.text: I was at this hotel recently for a month-long stay and I have to say the staff made my colleagues and I feel at home. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are spacious and clean. I've stayed in quite a few hotels and I found the free breakfast one of the best I've experienced. Every hotel staff I encountered always greeted me with a smile, including the cleaners, concierge, and staff serving the breakfast. They seem genuinely concerned that their guests are having an enjoyable and comfortable stay, which really showed in their service. I really couldn't have asked for more from this hotel. For anyone who decides to stay here, make sure you try one of their freshly baked cookies at the front desk!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable rooms and service with a smile!

reviews.text: I had a great stay, was on a trip with the whole family, just what i was looking for, very friendly staff and very helpfull, decent rooms, no surprises. I would stay there again and would recommend to others. Everything was great, just what one would expect from a location like this.
reviews.title: Great Place for decent Price
The friendliest hotel in the world.
reviews.text: This is the only place I'll stay while on business in Scarborough. The staff are so unbelievably friendly! Very close & convenient to highway without being noisy, free cookies on arrival (who doesn't love that?) and you can watch the news over brekkie the next morning. Aces.

Though this hotel is on the outskirts of Toronto, it offers good value, cleanliness, and easy access from the 401. The rooms are comfortable, and it is generally quiet despite the doors that close loudly enough to wake you up should you want to sleep in.
reviews.title: Clean, good value, but leave your laptop at home
One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at!
reviews.text: I travel alot and I can honestly say that I've never come accross a hotel in Toronto this good in a very VERY long time. The staff was great and extremely helpful and I slept awesome. When I travel to Toronto, this is where I am staying. A++, Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Great place..Clean...A++++
reviews.text: We already stayed twice on this hotel. Customer service is by far the best. Keg Restaurant is literally a couple of steps away from the hotel. With high speed internet and clean rooms, cant ask for more..

reviews.title: Cozy and comfortable..
reviews.text: Maraming salamat...

reviews.title: A sanctuary for weary travelers
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel after reading it rated #1 out of 12 in Scarborough, with 94 % recommending. I wasn't disappointed and previous guests clearly did not steer me wrong. The hotel staff was very friendly, patient and personable when asked about local restaurants, while this hotel is easy to get to when travelling on the 401. Right next door is a Keg Steak House, while other restaurants are within driving distance - probably the only downside if you dont feel like a steak at the Keg or eating at McDonalds. The front lobby decor is very inviting and reminded me of being at a beautiful chalet. Unfortunately I never got to enjoy the breakfast, buy the hotel lobby appeared nicely set up for relaxing or sititng at a table and working away. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable.

reviews.title: Really nice hotel to stay, very helpful staff.
reviews.text: We hadn't planned to stay at this hotel. But when a cockroach made its presence known upon entering the room we'd reserved at a nearby hotel, we hit the road. It was late in the evening when, frazzled, I arrived at the desk of the Holiday Inn Express Toronto East. Peter Atawa was sympathetic and delightful, telling us that it was our good fortune to have landed at his hotel. He gave us a choice of beds and prices and did his best to come up with a rate we could afford. He also told us about the "best hotel breakfast around" and encouraged us to take advantage of it.

reviews.title: Pancakes for breakfast!
reviews.text: Looks like a newly renovated hotel. Lobby welcoming and so was the staff. Room very comfortable. Walk next door to The Keg for dinner. Breakfast includes a pancake machine. Press a button and 45 seconds later 2 pancakes appear. Fun!

reviews.title: Never again!
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights. Found the lobby very deceiving. The lobby was very nice but the hallway smelled old and so did the room. The bathtub plumbing was not secured to the wall. The tv was very small and old,very fuzzy. Nice furniture in the room. Vending machines would only take quarters and front desk staff never anted to give up there change. We had to pay extra for parking each night. On a good note the breakfast was good. We found most of the staff to be very fake. There is no wireless internet. Not good when you rely on it. When the two of us checked in they gave us one free bottle of water and a ganola bar, not much for the other person in the room. The hotel was very hot. We kept the A/C on the whole stay but the lobby and hallways were very hot. I would not recommend this hotel. Much better lookng hotel next door. The new Best Western in the next parking lot. We tried to get a room there for two of our nights stay but they had no rooms available.

reviews.title: Comfortable room, helpful staff.
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for five days in May 2011 and was pleasantly surprised with how nice and accommodating the staff were. They even helped me with figuring out how to navigate the public transit. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, heat and A/C worked great. My only complaint was the wired Internet, as I would have liked to have been able to sit in one of the more comfortable chairs in the room while on my computer, or to have been able to watch a movie with my laptop on my bedside table. The internet speed was great though, and for a hotel to offer free internet is greatly appreciated. Breakfast in the morning was great - I liked that I could get oatmeal, yogurt, etc.

reviews.title: Good Location for Business Traveler
reviews.text: I lost an earring and scoured the room up and down for it one night, as it was a gift from my fiance and I felt horrible thinking I'd lost it. I left a note for housekeeping to ask them to please keep an eye out for my earring, but I figured I'd never see it again. When I got back for the day and went into my bathroom, I was so surprised to see my earring stuck right on the note I'd left. I don't know where they found it, I had turned that room upside down! Over and above what they needed to do.

reviews.title: Are you kidding me?
reviews.text: The staff here really care about their guests. A+.

reviews.title: Good rooms, great staff
reviews.text: We had a five-night stay just after Christmas, to reduce the population and stress at our family's house in Scarborough. The Holiday Inn Express Toronto East was a good place to stay. It's designed in the old style -- late 70s, early 80s? -- but was entirely serviceable and nicely updated in the main lobby areas. Very clean and very quiet, and the desk staff were excellent: always pleasant and greeted us as we arrived and left. The breakfast offerings were good, and I appreciated the range of food -- everything from cinnamon buns to yogurt, fruit and cereal.

reviews.title: Very dissapointed and insulted!
reviews.text: The only negative we experienced was a lack of hot water -- though I ran the tap as hot as I could, most nights all I could get was a lukewarm supply... it didn't trouble me enough at the time, however, to speak to the hotel about it.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!!
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and I must say this, being in the tourism industry, and knowing how competitive the market is - CUSTOMER SERVICE is key. A previous review said that the staff are not genuine and I would have to agree.

reviews.title: Decent hotel, but challenge them on the parking
reviews.text: Note: If you do not have a credit card - beware. It's a BIG issue. The first two times were not, and then they change the policies every time I visited this place.

reviews.title: Parking extra
reviews.text: The gentleman at the front desk makes everything a problem from checking in to checking out. If Mr. DeSouza would like more information please provide me with an e-mail address and I will gladly give you more information. The front desk agent was not only RUDE but he told his "trainee" to SHUT UP in front of me. Not very professional.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Toronto East Hotel
description: Welcome to One of the Best Toronto Hotels Around For superior service and amenities, come visit the 3-diamond AAA/CAA Holiday Inn Express Hotel Toronto East in Scarborough. Our hotel is 25 km from Pearson International Airport (YYZ). You'll find an abundance of attractions nearby. You can tour the famous Metro Toronto Zoo and Ontario Science Centre, head inside for shopping at Scarborough Town Centre and other local shopping centres or have fun outside at Edwards Garden. For your convenience, we have two desk top computers in the lobby with free high-speed Internet access to plan your day or print directions to your destination. Business travelers also enjoy our hotel's close proximity to Toyota Canada, Honda Canada, Scarborough Grace Hospital, Scarborough General Hospital, local colleges including Centennial College and the University of Toronto and other businesses in Scarborough. Our hotel's meeting space can accommodate gatherings for up to 50 people, and we have 24-hour business centre services to help you prepare for a meeting. Because each room in our hotel features triple-sheeted bedding, a 27-inch TV with in-room movies, and free high-speed Internet access you can expect a comfortable stay in Scarborough. Our hotel deals include a daily newspaper delivered to your room, a free hot breakfast bar each morning and access to the fitness centre. Reserve your room today at the Holiday Inn Express Toronto East Hotel.
